column1: full on off, hint of movement away, defended to point
wide of the crease, angled in, Rahane opens the face and tries to steer it down and nearly chops it on
length, drifting into the pads, whipped away nicely past squareleg's right for a couple
length outside off, steered to third-man
length outside off, hint of shape away again, left alone
length on off, Buttler shuffles across and defends to point
length outside off, punched straight to cover
length and wobbling in, pushed to mid-on
full outside off, half a stride forward and defended to cover
length on middle, Rahane takes a few steps forward and lifts it with the angle to deep square-leg's left. Got more elevation than power but enough to fetch him two
length, angled in, clipped away to deep squareleg's right this time for another couple
full on off, hint of movement back in, Rahane pushes it to mid-on and takes off for a quick single, Warner underarms's a throw at the non striker's but he was home.

Chipped just over Bhuvneshwar in his follow through! Length on middle, Rahane turned the face too early and the ball held in the surface a little, resulting in a leading edge that lobbed up just over the bowler
slower ball on off, punched to cover
short ball, extra bounce and pace, Buttler sways out of the way, surprised by how quickly it came on to him but called wide for height
slower ball outside off and punched between point and cover-point, all timing and that's his first four tonight
length, angled in, misses the flick and is struck on the thigh pad
slower ball, angled in, cramping him up, tucked away to deep backward squareleg for one
length on off, rushes on to him, nearly chops it back on attempting to cut

bowled him! Went for the sweep, premeditated, exposed his stumps, and that's a terrible idea against a wicket-to-wicket Rashid Khan, who thrives on batsmen trying to hit him across the line, especially with the new ball that slides on
edged and wide of slip! length outside off, had a tentative poke at it, there was extra bounce and a hint of turn
another attempted sweep and the top edge sails over the short fine-leg
full on off, defended
length outside off, tries to steer it down and is beaten
length outside off, steered to third-man
slower ball on off, makes room and goes inside out over the cover field, clears easily but not enough power to take it to the boundary
length on middle, a little shuffle across and out comes the short-arm pull through midwicket for four
slower ball on middle, pushed to mid-on
short and pulled to long-on all along the ground
full on off, turns the face too early and gets a leading edge down to third-man as the ball holds in the surface a little
length on off and nearly chipped to mid-on. Rahane early into the shot there, got it really low on the bat, but mistimed it so badly that it fell well short
length outside off, steered to third-man
length, angled in and climbing onto the batsman, adjusts well and steers to third-man
slower ball on middle, Rahane back away and tries to swat it down the ground, there's no timing as the ball trickles to mid-on to allow a single
length on off, presses forward and defends
full on middle, tucked away to deep midwicket
length outside off, pushed to cover-point
length outside off, the seam-up delivery, pushed to long-off
slower on middle, Rahane shuffles and turns it around towards deep midwicket
length on middle, the seam-up delivery that slides in, Samson picks it up with the angle and slog sweeps it over the deep squareleg fence
slower on off, Samson waits for it and taps it between point and cover-point for one
length on middle, clipped to midwicket
short ball, surprises the batsman with pace and bounce, left alone and called wide for height

slower ball, he picks it up early and deposits it high and handsome over the deep midwicket fielder, who briefly felt he was in with a chance, timed his jump well but only got fingertips to it as it sailed over
length on middle, pushed to long-on
length on off, Rahane pushes it aerially towards mid-off and scampers a single
length, angled in, pushed to midwicket and they go for a quick single, Could have been close at the non-striker's end but he was probably home
full on off, drilled to mid-off, hit too hard for a quick single
length on middle, Samson stays rooted to the crease but brings his bat down in time to push it to long-on
length, angled in, Rahane shapes for the reverse sweep, doesn't time it but gets a single to point
full on middle, Samson shuffles, goes down on one knee and taps it on its head to pick a smart boundary. dangerous shot, however
length, quicker one, really hurried on to him, pushed to deep midwicket
length on off, pushed back to the bowler
full outside off, draws him forward, it's the legspinner this time and it beats his outside edge
length on middle, stands tall and pushes it to long-on
length, angled in, down the track comes Rahane and pushes it to long-on's right, who does well to keep it to one
short and pulled along the ground to deep midwicket
full on off, seam-up delivery, Rahane goes inside out over extra cover, times it beautifully but Rashid Khan does brilliantly to keep the ball in play and keep them to two
length on middle, down the track comes Rahane and goes straight over the bowler's head with a little more power this time and it clears the ropes
full on middle, shuffles and pushes it towards deep squareleg and they convert it into a couple
lofts him over mid-off. So casual. That's Samson in full flow. Overpitched on off stump, doesn't even bother getting the front leg out. Waits on it and opens the face late to pick up four easy runs
leading edge safely in front of mid-off. Looks to flick this through midwicket, a length ball on middle, but it's a knuckle ball and he hasn't picked it
length on leg stump, flicked on the rise to deep square leg. And he's overstepped
only a run. Full and wide outside off, jammed out to the sweeper
short of a length and in at off stump, opens the face, arches into the leg side and runs this down to third man
well placed! Kaul letting Royals get into this now. Short ball, not quick enough for this pitch. Rahane leaps off the floor and gets this hook to deep square's right
length on leg stump, whipped to midwicket on the up
for starters, it goes over the long leg boundary! Overpitched leg stump ball, Rahane leans in and clips it with the pace to deep square's right
length on middle stump, punched handsomely back down the pitch, but Shankar lunges to the right and parries it to long-on
full outside off, and once again those jelly wrists of Samson. Whips to long-on's right, only one
length on middle stump, gets forward and clips to long-on on the rise
super, super Sanju! Slower ball, tossed up full outside off. He picks it, waits on it, and drills it over extra cover. What hands!
yorker length just outside off, looks to chop it behind point, beaten on the under-edge
fifty. Good acceleration from Rahane and Royals can go big now. Picks this googly, gets on the back foot and dabs it through square leg
googly on the pads, looks to flick, cops it on the pad
slider at a length on middle stump, gets low and sweeps to deep backward square
they're checking if there was an edgeYes there was! They don't review. Rahane looked to sweep that, got an inside edge onto back pad
length at the stumps, swiped to deep square
length on middle, paddled to short fine
slower ball at off stump, flicked uppishly to deep square

past extra cover's dive and then beats Rashid's at deep cover, to his right. Williamson the first barrier - doesn't dive because of his wonky shoulder. But a stunning shot from Rahane in the first place: on his toes and regally punched on the rise outside off
chipped over the bowler. On a length outside off, rising up, but he goes with it. Gets it between long-on and long-off
full slower ball on  middle stump, flicked uppishly to long-on

the bowler can't gather and Rahane completes the second! A century stand with that second, but nearly 99. A glorious cover drive to Rashid's right at sweeper but his throw is low and Sandeep not agile after running back to the stumps
short of a length outside off, uses his wrists to drag this to deep midwicket's right to bring up his fifty.
length outside off, leans in for the drive. Not to the pitch and this grips in the surface. Just past the bowler, high to his left
hello! Anchor, who? Rahane plonks the front leg across off stump and skies this reverse sweep to comfortably beat short third and backward point. Lovely shot
length at middle stump, leans in, pushes into the leg side with hard hands. Rashid too quick to allow a run
diving stop at short fine. Length on middle stump, looks to sweep, inside edge
beaten. Plays for the googly outside off, but this zips away from a length
they won't review this caught-behind call down leg. Googly, short of a length on the pads. Looks to glance it. Bairstow holds on down leg side and the appeal is turned down
crunches it over deep extra! That's not an easy shot on a slow pitch against a spinner. Whew, some timing. Full on off, backs away and goes inside-out with great effect
length on leg stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
past Bairstow and straight into the boundary behind him. Short and down leg side. Steps across and gently ramps this
tossed up outside off, met on the full, driven straight to sweeper cover

taken at long-on! Rahane's watch has ended. Quality innings by the end. He's beaten by a quality ball though. Nadeem hangs this up at a length on middle. Draws him out of his crease but beats him in flight. Not to the pitch as he looks to loft this and it comes off the inside half and is taken a few yards inside
short of a length outside off, punches to sweeper cover on the up
full toss outside off, thumped to deep midwicket's left
length on leg stump, punched straight to midwicket
short of a length just outside off, chopped to third man with the angle

dropped! Three fielders under it and if you have your money on the keeper, you've just lost it. Slower ball outside off, Samson wants to whip into the leg side and gets a top edge into the square leg region. Bairstow calls for it, perhaps rightly so, but is just a tad late on it and ends up lunging forward and low as he puts this down facing the midwicket boundary
full toss outside off, flicked to deep square
a dot to finish. Superb over. Slower ball, short of a length outside off. Looks to cut, gets an inside edge towards the keeper. Only five off the over
launches it over the wide long-off boundary. Lovely flow through the line from Samson. Length outside off and he stands still and deftly goes from down to up, perfectly out of the middle of the bat
superb! What would you pay for those wrists? Yorker length delivery at the stumps. Gets low and opens the face so very late to get it past backward point. Stunning, stunning.
and again! Get out of here! Full again and closer to off stump this time. Gets his hands from in to out and blazes it past backward point yet again
slower ball at a length, expertly nudges with soft hands through midwicket and they pick up an easy two. Masterful from Samson, these last four balls

there's more. If there's perfection in batting, we might have seen it in the last five balls. Complete control from Samson. Short of a length legcutter outside off, backs away and slices this between backward point and short third

...but it won't matter! Overpitched outside off, stays leg side of it and adjusts his timing to get this well in front of deep backward point. The method is the same: wait, open the face, pick your spot. But the execution is different. And it is perfect. What a sensational over of T20 batting.
low full toss outside off, steps out and gets it to extra cover off the toe end
gets pumped over square leg! A thigh high full toss on leg stump to Samson. Is there any surprise where this ends up?
superb from Warner at long-on to save two. Full toss outside off, punched to his right there but Warner sprints, leaps, slides, gets up in no time and keeps this to two
slower ball at a length wide outside off, mistimed drive to long-off's left
length ball wide outside off. Looks to carve this over extra cover, gets it to long-on off the toe-end

just clears extra cover. He'll be disappointed not getting better connection on this. Length ball outside off with lots of room to swing through the line. Ended up with a turning bat as he made contact

reverse ramp! Stokes with some genius of his own! Gets low too early for the ramp over short fine. Bhuvi follows him with a full one across his body and Stokes quickly swivels to go the other way. Uses the angle and gets it over short third
length ball wide outside off, chucks his hands at this but gets yet another one off the toe-end. On the bounce to extra cover

and he gets hundred! Fifty-four balls! What a gorgeous, gorgeous innings. Usually is when this guy stays for a prolonged period. Short of a length outside off and he slaps it off the front foot. Long-on does well to get a hand with his dive to the left, but he only parries it into the boundary
yorker length on leg stump, clipped to deep square
full and down leg side, whips out at it but can't connect. Bairstow doesn't collect cleanly

ramp again! Length ball pushed across him again. Just a tad shorter than the one he reverse ramped, so he can still fall over into the off side and get this into the leg side. Does exactly that and gets it between keeper and short fine

thick outside edge over short third and they get 198! An offcutter, short of a length outside off. Stays too far leg side of it and throws his hands again. This time it evades the toe-end and gets just enough to clear the fielder and run away
length on the pads, movement back in but that only helps Warner, as he tickles it fine for four
length outside off, pushed to cover, Bairstow, the non striker just took off and could have been close at his end as he scampered back
length on middle, swinging back in, tucked away through squareleg for two
length and crack! Stand and deliver stuff from Warner, picked up the length and hammered him over deep midwicket
slower ball on off, Bairstow takes off again and has to dive to make his ground at the non-striker's after he was wisely sent back by Warner
length and swinging in, down the leg side, called wide
length on off, slower ball, pushed between point and cover-point for one
length, angled in, uses it cleverly and picks him up wide of short fine-leg for four. Great manipulation of the field
length, fired in, makes room and punches it towards cover for one
length on middle, tucked away to deep midwicket
length, angled in, down the leg side, and all Warner has to do is get a slight deflection and it races away for four
full on the pads, slower, tucked away through midwicket
length on off, punched to cover
yorker on off, digs it out towards square leg and they get through for a quick single after an early call from Warner
length on the pads and clipped away to deep squareleg
slower ball and hammered straight to mid-on
length outside off, width on offer, Warner punches it to deep point's left for two
full and wide, Warner reaches out and slices it past deep point's right
length on middle, slower ball, tucked away to deep squareleg to retain strike
length on middle, Warner swings hard and too early and gets an inside edge back onto his body
length on middle, cramping him up, Warner hurried for pace there and takes on the body after a slight top edge
full outside off, pushed to mid-off and they scamper one
short and quick outside off, Bairstow calmly sways out of its way
length into the body, Bairstow swivels to pull it away, it doesn't rise too high and he is struck on the thigh pad
short and hurries onto him,Bairstow is late on the pull, splices it wide of midwicket
length on middle, Warner rocks back and hammers a pull wide of mid-on
slower ball outside off, pitched in the slot and Warner lofts him over mid-off, couple of bounces and into the boundary
slower ball on off, cramping him for room from around the wicket, Warner pushes it to mid-off
length outside off, he backs away and goes over extra cover this time. Another boundary
full on the pads, clipped away to deep squareleg
length outside off, bit of width, Bairstow flashes and gets an outside edge wide of the keeper for the fourth boundary of the over
length on off and Warner isn't sparing anyone here. Swatted past Archer, flat and hard, straight down the ground
length on middle, extra bounce but Warner gets on top of it and defends back to the bowler

length outside off, backs away and lofts it just over mid-off to bring up his fifty with a couple. That held up in the pitch a little and he was cramped for room but had enough behind it to clear the fielder by inches
length on middle, Warner swings wildly and gets a thick inside edge towards  squareleg
length on the pads and Bairstow joins the fun, whips it away towards deep squareleg
length outside off, Bairstow backs away and crunches it between point and cover-point to finish the Power-Play in style. Predictable bowling from Archer
full on off, pushed to long-off
length on off, googly, cramps him for room as he tries to cut
length on middle, swept away towards deep squareleg who makes a meal of it, misjudging the turn to his right after it landed
length outside off, tucked away towards deep squareleg
length on middle, doesn't bounce as much as Warner might have expected from that length but he manages it well, goes low with his hands and pulls it all along the ground to deep midwicket
full outside off, in the slot and Warner hammers it flat and hard, down the ground for six
full outside off, slower in pace but Warner checks his drive beautifully and caresses it though extra cover
full on off, fired in, pushed to long-off
full on off, down the wicket comes Bairstow and pushes it along the ground to long-on
length on the pads, fired in, tucked away to deep squareleg
length on off, Bairstow turns it around with his wrists towards deep squareleg to retain strike
length on the pads, tucked away towards deep midwicket
length on the pads, tucked away between deep midwicket and deep squareleg and they run hard to complete two
length on middle, rocks back and pulls along the ground to long-on
length on middle, skips down the wicket, misses the flick and takes it on the thigh pad, his second line of defence
short and hammered over deep midwicket! He has been threatening to drag them down for a while and Bairstow was ready for it
length on the pads, tucked away between deep midwicket and deepo squareleg and they complete another well-run couple
length on the pads Warner was hurried a little as he tried to tuck it away, gets it on the thigh pad and they scamper one
length outside off, Bairstow backs away and slashes it past point for another boundary. That's his area square of the wicket on the off side
length on off, pushed to mid-off and they complete a quick single with the fielder hanging back on the circle
short ball, hurries onto Warner, cramped him for room so he was caught in an awkward tangle, unable to free his arms for the full-fledged pull and that's the breakthrough for the Royals
length outside off, too much width and Baistow continues on his merry way, slashes it away past point again. Poor bowling
length outside off, slashed and nearly carries to third-man. He's dropped that. It was dying on him a little, but either way he couldn't hang on and Bairstow retains strike
length outside off, defended into the off side
length outside off, sliced to sweeper cover
length outside off, gets forward and stabs into the cover region
length just outside off, mistimed punched to extra cover's right. A diving stop
length just outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot

he's held on! Dhawal Kulkarni makes up, and how! Skips up at long-off and stretches his hands back to hold on! A full ball from Gopal, drilled flat by Bairstow. And after putting down a sitter, he drags this back after it has nearly cleared him. The keeps his shape and lands in front of the rope. Superb
welcome back, KW. The square drive, his best shot by far. Length outside off, he leans in and opens the face late to get this to backward point's left
length outside off, sliced uppishly towards third man
length outside off, driven on the rise to sweeper cover
skids away from Unadkat at deep square. Short ball pulled uppishly to deep square's left. One bounce and over the boundary
length on off stump, defended with soft hands into the covers
slower ball at a length outside off, stabbed into the point region
length at leg stump, flicked to deep square's right off the back foot
just clears mid-off. Cross-seam ball digs into the surface and stops on him as he looks to drive through the line
length at middle stump, whipped across the line to deep midwicket
short of a length outside off, opens the face and runs this down
slower ball, short of a length just outside off. Opens the face and gets this straight to short third
beaten. Short of a length across the corridor, looks to play the late cut, beaten

backs away and smokes it over long-on! Whew. This was not the player who burst into Ranji cricket with a perfect technique 3-4 years ago. How he has evolved. Short ball at middle stump, makes room and flat-bats it.
length outside off, opens the face and runs it straight to short third man
length outside off, opens the face, runs it to third man
clears deep midwicket on the long side! Kulkarni with some poor lengths this over. Short outside off, clears the front leg and wallops this. A proper slog.
full on leg stump, clipped between deep square and deep midwicket
overpitched outside off, looks to drill it through the off side. Goes too hard. Gets it to long-on along the floor
sweeps him! Slower ball picked up from a length outside off. Gets on one knee and smokes it over the midwicket boundary!
full on off stump, driven uppishly to long-off
past point. Poor ball, really. Short, slanted across KW. Quick hands and this whistles past the fielder

finds point! Runs down the pitch and loses some shape this time. Cut might have been on again if he stayed in the crease, but he was reaching out after getting down the track. Sliced straight to Tripathi
past the hook but also above the head, deems leg umpire. Bouncer has some steep rise on it but it's in the batsman's favour by the end of it
full outside off, gets his front leg into the leg side and drives straight to mid-off
well bowled. An offcutter in the corridor from around. Pandey swishes at it and is beaten
length outside off, looks to drive through cover, gets it to midwicket off the inside half
length at off, defended to extra cover's left

taken at long-on! Wow. Another wicket here and we might still have a game. Gopal delivers. And he often has for them, without too much of the spotlight. This is a slider, full on middle stump. Shankar wants to pump him over long-on but is done by the extra slide off the surface. Drags it off the inside half to the fielder. But what an innings, it seems he's making a statement every time he comes out on a field these days

he's got him! First ball after the break and a celebration that isn't in the same class as the ball he's just bowled. Gopal sends off his state captain. This skids on from outside off. Pandey is stabbing away from the body for the legbreak as he's caught dead in front of off stump
short of a length and in at leg stump, gets on the back foot and clips this through square leg
what is fear? Yusuf with a big stride down the pitch and an almighty drill down to long-off
yorker length wide outside off, reaches out and jams it to third man's right
what is fear, indeed?!  Yusuf Pathan, calm as. Short of a length at off stump, gets nicely behind the line and swipes magnificently to send this flat and over the square leg boundary
yorker just outside off, looks to run it down, beaten
yorker, 151kph, right at off stump. Superb. Yusuf does well to get bat on it
short of a length in the corridor, looks to pull, mistimes completely. Sliced over the umpire but safe
bouncer too short. Rashid is ducking rapidly at this, but it's Buttler with the real work. One handed leap to hold on to that. It was sailing
full on off stump, mistimed tap back to the bowler
short of a length, wide outside off. Cut to sweeper cover
slower ball, dug in back of a length outside off. Past Rashid's attempted cut
slower ball at a length outside off, drives with the turn away, to sweeper
slower bouncer, dug in too short. Doesn't even need to duck at that
falls short of long-on running to his right! Pathan was outfoxed there. Slower ball cutting across him outside off. Looked to slug that but got it off the bottom
slower ball, short outside off. Spanked off the back foot but can't beat Rahane's dive at extra cover
short of a length outside off, pulls to deep midwicket's right and comes back for the second. Long boundary there
yorker right up at off stump. Can't do anything other than drill that back towards mid-off
just misses on the yorker but Pathan misses out too. Low full toss outside off, scythed to third man's right
misses on the yorker again. Once again only one. Rashid sets up for the helicopter, but this is too quick. Mistimed bunt towards Stokes at long-on
oh superb bowling. Bowls the yorker at will. Just in the corridor. Gets the front leg out of the way but chops it off the under-edge into the gully region
loses his radar! Small margins. Full and slanted down leg side. Rashid sets up for the helicopter again. Misses again
shot! Superb thinking under pressure from Rashid. Takes a big step back into the crease and sets up low with a low backlift. Gets a full one at off stump and creams it past extra cover

whips it over the square leg boundary! Oh what a shot! He hit one like this against KKR last season and repeats it. Step back into the crease, weight transfer towards point as this yorker full ball comes in at middle stump, and he uses the pace to clip it with fast wrists to seal the win with six balls to spare
